newsitem.title: USA: USX-US Steel seeks acquisitions, mergers-WSJ.
newsitem.headline: USX-US Steel seeks acquisitions, mergers-WSJ.

text.p: USX Corp's U.S. Steel Group is actively seeking prospective acquisitions, partnerships or mergers, the Wall Street Journal said on Friday.
U.S. Steel President Paul Wilhelm told analysts in New York it was looking at steelmakers which would make a strategic fit, the paper said in its electronic edition.
The newspaper said Wilhelm did not name specific targets but named strengths U.S. Steel was looking for, such as contracts with Japanese automakers operating in the United States.
According to analysts who attended the meeting, Wilhelm cited National Steel Corp and Inland Steel Industries as good fits, the paper said.
None of the companies was immediately available to comment. The paper said neither Wilhelm nor the other companies would confirm any talks.

An Inland Steel spokesman was quoted in the paper as saying the "company is not for sale and never has been for sale." But according to an industry official familiar with Inland and USX, the companies have talked in the past year, the Journal said.
National Steel is controlled by Japan's NKK Corp.
